chapter.title: Ambiguity Resolution Information
chapter.para:
Ambiguity resolution is performed in baseline mode, using various methods depending on the baseline length, i.e.
Direct L1/L2 method (< 11 km)
Phase-based widelane/narrowlane method (< 201 km)
Quasi-Ionosphere-Free (QIF) approach (< 2000 km)
Melbourne-Wuebbena approach (< 6000 km)
When needed, GNSS-derived global ionosphere map information is used to support ambiguity resolution. More information on this map is given in
The following table, summarizes the ambiguity resolution information for the network.
